Dear Team DeepLabCut,

Recently I have installed the latest update which you have released. During
training it keeps giving a certain error which online states its okey or
that someone else is closing the queue, but thats not the case here. This
error occurs at 200.000 iterations if I want to train my network for
1.000.000 iterations and directly after 1000 iterations if I am trying to
train my network for a 1000 iterations. The error message is shown below
(image 1 and 2). Could you tell me what is going on and how to fix this? (I
already looked at the GPU usage, which had enough space to run
the training) I also tried to continue since it states that the network is
trained by evaluating the network, but it gives an ModuleNotFoundError: No
module named 'easydict'....
[image: image.png]
[image: image.png]
Kind regards,

CastielFracs

Since you are running maDLC, I believe that the maximum iterations are limited to 200k even if you set the number higher (see [docs](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/maDLC_UserGuide.md)). If you need more iterations, you can run for 200k, then train again but set the last checkpoint as your `init_weights`, and the next round of training will start from where the previous round finished.

More importantly, you shouldn't need to train that much. The fact that you're having tracking and switching problems after training that much suggests that either your video is not clear, there is an error in your labelling, or you have skipped some other steps. 

Did you check all of your labels and make sure there aren't any improperly placed labels? Even 1 out of 700 can cause problems. Did you only label clearly visible landmarks, or did you guess where landmarks are even when occluded?

When you created your training data set, did you crop images and labels? This will let you use a larger batch size.

What batch size are you using? If you are using batch size of 8 for training (set in `pose_cfg.yaml` in train folder, not in the config.yaml file), you should only need 20k-50k iterations. If your GPU has 12 GB, you should be able to use batch size of 8 for images cropped to 400x400.

During training, does the loss plateau? At what value? What are the evaluation results? If after training to 200k loss doesn't plateau below 0.1 (or 0.01), and evaluation results show rmse higher than 2-5 pixels, then you probably have errors in your labels.

Dear Brandon Jackson,

Using this program before, I was able to run 1M iterations, is this limited
since the latest update?

I have gone over the labels and they appear to be fine, will recheck it
later today again. I did not label landmarks that were unclear.

I have not used crops because my boss stated that this was probably the
cause of various issues regarding the marks moving far away from the mice.
Would you recommend them instead?

Currently I am using a batch size of 8, the GPU only has 8 gb though.

During training loss value plateaus at the value of 0.0007, so I reckon
that the labels are proper then? I do have 1 video in which a part of the
view is blocked by a black bar, does this in general affect things or
should it still run properly?

Thanks so much for your help.

Kind regards,

CastielFracs

Op di 1 jun. 2021 om 16:38 schreef Brandon Jackson ***@***.***
>:

> @CastielFracs <https://github.com/CastielFracs> , yes the 200k iteration
> limit was set in a recent update, but it's there in part because maDLC
> projects are expected to use cropping, and thus larger batch sizes, and
> therefore not need that many training iterations. I have very complicated
> videos of flying birds against messy backgrounds and never have to train
> more than 50k iterations at batch size of 8 (25k at batch size of 16). Yes,
> I would crop before creating the training dataset (but you might create a
> copy of the whole project as a backup before running that), and then try a
> higher batch size (10, or 12), then train for 50k iterations.
>
> That loss is very good. What are the rmse following evaluation of the
> network?
>
> It's also hard to tell what could be happening without seeing the video.
> Can you post a screen grab of a video to GitHub? Or maybe just one of your
> labeled images produced by check labels?
>
> 窶能n> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1196#issuecomment-852179749>,
> or unsubscribe

Dear Brandon Jackson,

I have currently run a new data set all made within the 2.rc2.1 update
(labelled all the frames again (200 should in general be enough right?),
created dataset etc) with your proposed batch size but instead with 10.000
iterations to test whether the message regarding 'skipping cancelled
enqueue attempt with queue not closed' and the following 'Caused by op
'fifo_queue_enqueue', defined at...' would persist as previously mentioned.
This occurred again but the program appears to work, but the quality was
not as high at 10.000 (as expected, I will give an update and video once I
have trained it at higher iterations because I feel like this problem might
persist), so is this 'error' that will affect my results or is this just
the newest update message stating that it's done with training?

Furthermore, I was wondering if your team is going to do a little
video/blog post on the new settings availability in the refine tracklet and
analyze video tabs, I observed various parameters regarding switching etc
which would be quite useful to have more information about the way it
affects the network.

Also, it appears that new labeled frames made in the newest update version
do not require easydict, while the network I trained before the update
cannot be evaluated without easydict, do you know what happens there?

Kind regards,

CastielFracs
